title: [FR] Add log_batch to the MLflow fluent API

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.

### Proposal Summary

Implement the method `MLflowClient.log_batch()` in the MLflow fluent API as `mlflow.log_batch()` to improve discoverability and prevent users to rely on multiple calls to `mlflow.log_metric()` when logging curves/arrays of values. Alternatively, allow `mlflow.log_metric()` to accept an array of timestep/value pairs and leverage `MLflowClient.log_batch()` under the hood.

### Motivation

> #### What is the use case for this feature?

When logging metrics, users uses most of the time the fluent API `mlflow.log_metric()`. If the user wants to log multiple timesteps of the same metric (for instance for a curve), then they have two options: 1) calling multiple times `mlflow.log_metric()` or by leveraging the method `MLflowClient.log_batch()`. Option 2 is harder to discover as it requires the user to create an `MLflowClient` in order to find it. That leads them to the use of iterators with `mlflow.log_metric()`, which then translates to poor performance.

`mlflow.log_metrics` is implemented, however, this method logs multiple metrics while the job to be done here is to log multiple values for the same metric.

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?

Most ML training routines need to log curves/array of values. However, the method  `MLflowClient.log_batch()` is hard to discover leading users to use `mlflow.log_metric` with iterators. The later leads customers to poor performance.

> #### Why is this use case valuable to support for your project(s) or organization?

Some as above.

> #### Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case?

`MLflowClient` is hardly used (or known) by users inside training routines. 


### Details

Implement the method `MLflowClient.log_batch()` in the MLflow fluent API as `mlflow.log_batch()` to improve discoverability and prevent users to rely on multiple calls to `mlflow.log_metric()` when logging curves/arrays of values. Alternatively, allow `mlflow.log_metric()` to accept an array of timestep/value pairs and leverage `MLflowClient.log_batch()` under the hood.
